intro: Borreria quadrisulcata, commonly known as the four-groove borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves with four distinct longitudinal grooves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Borreria quadrisulcata is often found in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
